articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: Death toll tops 700, with more than 2,841 new infections taking the total past 34,000 across the country.
articles.content:
The number of deaths from China's coronavirus outbreak has risen to 717 on Saturday, surpassing the toll from the SARS outbreak on the mainland and Hong Kong almost two decades ago.
Another 81 people died from the virus in central Hubei province, where the d… [+5824 chars]

articles.title: Has the coronavirus cracked the great firewall of China?
articles.description: Online anger simmers after the disease kills a doctor who was punished for sounding the alarm.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Mass wedding in South Korea despite coronavirus fear
articles.description: Despite concerns about the spread of the virus, a mass Unification Church wedding has gone ahead in South Korea.
articles.content:
There has been a mass wedding in South Korea despite coronavirus fear. Many of the 6,000 couples wore face masks.
Festivals, concerts and graduation ceremonies have been cancelled because of the risk.
But the church says it went ahead with the weddings as i… [+207 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Hong Kong unveils virus quarantine plans
articles.description: Anyone arriving from mainland China from Saturday will have to undergo 14 days 'compulsory' quarantine.
articles.content:
Hong Kong on Friday said it will deploy an army of volunteers to bolster plans to forcibly quarantine all arrivals from mainland China, warning that anyone caught breaching the new rules faces up to six months in prison.
In a major escalation in its battle a… [+2670 chars]

articles.author: Jonah Hull
articles.title: Coronavirus: Chinese businesses suffer in London
articles.description: London's Chinatown goes quiet as customers stay away amid news of third person infected with virus in UK.
articles.content:
As a third person is diagnosed with coronavirus in the United Kingdom, many Chinese businesses in London have taken a hit.
Restaurants in the capital's normally bustling Chinatown are now nearly empty.
And some ethnic Chinese have reported feeling singled o… [+81 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Explainer: Battle against Coronavirus
articles.description: Some drugmakers are expected to begin vaccine tests on humans, possibly within three months.
articles.content:
Researchers around the world are racing to find a vaccine for the coronavirus.
At the moment, there is no vaccine or known cure for this new virus.
What we do know is that it most likely passed from animals to humans in a market, in the Chinese city of Wuha… [+174 chars]

articles.title: Chinese doctor who sounded alarm about Wuhan coronavirus dies
articles.description: Dr Li Wenliang, a 34-year-old ophthalmologist, was reprimanded by officials after warning about the disease in December.
articles.content:
The Chinese doctor who got in trouble with authorities in the communist country for sounding an early warning about the coronavirus outbreak died on Friday after coming down with the illness.

articles.title: Is the Wuhan coronavirus outbreak threatening Xi's hold to power?
articles.description: Analysts debate whether Chinese leader will emerge from crisis unscathed, or face political and social instability.
articles.content:
A deadly coronavirus outbreak in China's Wuhan is proving to be one of the biggest tests of President Xi Jingping's eight-year leadership.
